intro: Vandellia subulata, commonly known as the slender vandellia, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Brazil. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its small, narrow leaves and delicate, pale yellow to white flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests or along stream banks. Its botanical features make it a unique and relatively rare species within its native habitat.
